clinical_study.brief_title: Human Subject Study on the Cognitive Effects of Anesthesia on Children Anesthetized Prior to 5 Years Old
clinical_study.official_title: Is Pediatric Anesthesia Associated With Long-term Hippocampal Dysfunction?

brief_summary.textblock: Anesthesia for more than 2h given to children of less than 3 years of age without coexisting diseases of the central nervous system or the heart cause long-term impairment of recognition memory.

primary_outcome.measure: Examine hippocampal-dependent memory on 6-11 yr-old children that previously received an anesthetic between birth and 8 yrs of age for greater than 120 min. duration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess hippocampal-dependent memory on 6-11 yr old children that were exposed to an anesthetic of less than 30 min., 30-90 min. or greater than 120 min. between birth and 8 yrs of age.

clinical_study.condition: Focus of Study to Find the Limits of Anesthesia Induced Impairment in Hippocampal Function in Children That Undergo Anesthesia at a Young Age.

arm_group.description: 6-11 year olds anesthetized at 0-8 yrs old for 30-90min
6-11 yr olds anesthetized at 0-8 yrs old for <30min
6-11 yr olds anesthetized at 0-8yrs old for >120 min
6-11 yr olds that have never been anesthetized

study_pop.textblock: Children currently 6-11 years old who have been anesthetized between birth and 8 years old and a matched group of children that did not undergo anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- General anesthesia for 5 minutes or greater between birth and 8 years of age
- Use of volatile anesthetic (sevoflurane, isoflurane, halothane or desflurane) with or without nitrous oxide for maintenance of anesthesia.
- Use of fentanyl or morphine as opioids and midazolam as premedication.
- Control subjects must never have been exposed to anesthesia or sedation for any procedure.
- English and Spanish speaking subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any other agents such as ketamine, meperdinie, barbiturates, etomidate, methoxyflurane, chloral hyrate, methodone or lorazepam.
- Low birth weight (<25th percentile)
- premature birth at <36 weeks
- color blindness
- history of brain disease including head trauma
- presence of congenital heart disease
- significant low blood pressure during their surgery (<30% of baseline for >5min)
- abnormal temperature (deviation from 36.5 degrees C by >1.5 degree C at any point)
- slow heart rate
- low blood oxygen saturation (<93% for >5min.)
- high arterial carbon dioxide levels (>60mmHg for >5min.)
- control subjects are excluded for any exposure to anesthesia or sedation
